basics.name: Daniel Kathein
basics.summary: AI undergraduate student at Carnegie Mellon University in the School of Computer Science. Passionate about machine learning, LLMs, and software development

education.area: Bachelor of Science in Artificial Intelligence, School of Computer Science

work.name: CMU Language Technologies Institute, Li Lab
work.summary: Delved into delving into LLMs for code generation and pioneered a novel non-greedy tokenization algorithm to improve performance on spelling and string manipulation tasks.

work.summary: Developing a comprehensive academic resource centralization platform for CMU students.

work.name: Freelance
work.summary: Built full-stack solutions for e-commerce monitoring on 15+ retailer sites and other custom software needs.
highlights: Facilitated $400K+ in generated revenue for Amazon, Walmart, and other retailers from 1500+ total users.

awards.title: Outstanding Academic Achievement Award

projects.name: Multi-Camera Association with Transformers
projects.description: Conducted 325+ hours of research at the University of Florida under Dr. Henry Medeiros, designing a cutting-edge multi-camera tracking algorithm with Local Feature Transformer; performed large experiments tuning 8 parameters.
highlights: Conducted research at the University of Florida under Dr. Henry Medeiros, designing a cutting-edge multi-camera tracking algorithm with Local Feature Transformer
Presented at the 2022 International Forum on Research Excellence and 2023 Florida JSEHS Symposium competition, securing 4th place overall and the Regional Recognition Award among the top 6 speakers
Granted 1st place in Intelligent Machines, Robotics, and Systems Software at the Broward Science and Engineering Fair

projects.name: Epileptic Seizure Prediction with Long Short-Term Memory
projects.description: Developed advanced RNN, LSTM, and GRU models for high-accuracy epileptic seizure detection from EEG data.
highlights: Developed advanced RNN, LSTM, and GRU models for high-accuracy epileptic seizure detection from EEG data.
